duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop, prepare, and teach a variety of coursework in Macroeconomics, Microeconomics, and Business or other pure and applied economics courses.
Conduct research and develop grant proposals to enhance the School of Business general programs.
Provide service to the Department, School, and University.
Mentor and engage with students in alignment with the mission and vision of the University and school.
Stay current in the discipline and related pedagogy.
Contribute to the intellectual and academic life of the department, University, and community.
Advise students, serve on committees, and participate in the broader university communities.
Engage in ongoing professional development, especially activities that advance student engagement, learning, and equity.
Student recruitment, academic advising, campus committees, curriculum development, and community outreach.

education_certification.credential: Ph.D. in Economics, Business, or closely related areas with at least 18 credit hours of economics or related applied economics.
Master's degree with at least 18 graduate hours in Economics is required.
Evidence of high-quality teaching experience and a demonstrated ability to communicate with and mentor diverse populations.
Relevant professional experience, industry certification, online learning credentials, and a demonstrated record of grants, research, and scholarship.
